item.title: 'Your move, Mr President': North Korea sets the stage for Biden
item.description: Kim Jong-un says he wants more and better weapons - so how will the next US president respond?

item.title: Sriwijaya Air crash: Indonesia divers search wreckage as black box hunt resumes
item.description: Divers resume their search for the black boxes after a passenger plane crashed into the Java Sea.

item.title: Sex and the City: New series announced but Kim Cattrall won't return
item.description: The much-loved TV series is back with a new name but only three of the original four leads will star.

item.title: Trump golf course stripped of 2022 US PGA
item.description: Trump National in Bedminster is stripped of the 2022 US PGA Championship, with organisers saying using the course would be "detrimental".

item.title: William Burns: Biden nominates veteran diplomat as CIA director
item.description: William Burns, who served for three decades as a diplomat, was key in reaching the Iran nuclear deal.

item.title: California prison break: Six inmates on run after improvised rope escape
item.description: The "armed and dangerous" men used an improvised rope made of braided sheets to escape.

item.title: Ugandans warned not to eat dead fish washed ashore
item.description: This comes after a large-scale death of fish was reported on Lake Victoria and the River Nile.

item.title: Yemen war: US to designate Houthi rebels as terrorist organisation
item.description: Aid groups say it may threaten operations in areas where millions of people are facing starvation.

item.title: Storm Filomena: Spain races to clear snow as temperatures plunge
item.description: Extra measures are taken to distribute Covid vaccines amid fears the snow could turn to ice.

item.title: Beny Steinmetz: Mining tycoon in Swiss trial over Guinea deal
item.description: Billionaire Beny Steinmetz denies alleged corruption over a huge iron ore deal in Guinea.

item.title: Irish 'laughing dad' goes viral
item.description: County Mayo man howls with laughter while trying to record a birthday message for his son.

item.title: In pictures: Storm Filomena hits Spain as Greeks bask in heatwave
item.description: Spain has seen heavy snow and plunging temperatures, while in Greece it is unusually warm.

item.title: When driving a tuk-tuk pays more than making art
item.description: Papier mache artisans in Kashmir are giving up the dying craft for more lucrative jobs.

item.title: Snow storms bring deadly chaos to Japan
item.description: Japan is hit by severe snow storms, killing at least eight and bringing some regions to a standstill.

item.title: How South African police are tackling pangolin smugglers
item.description: The pangolin is said to be the world's most trafficked mammal. The BBC reports on a rescue operation.

item.title: Singapore: Why these defiant 'nail house' owners refuse to sell
item.description: A block of luxury flats in Singapore is being built around two homes whose owners refuse to move.

item.title: Secret artists and their mini buildings for mice
item.description: From record stores to pharmacies, secret artist group AnonyMouse have been creating little places for mice.

item.title: A night at India's largest farmers' protest
item.description: Thousands of farmers have been camped outside the national capital for nearly two months now.

item.title: Capitol riots: Black Americans decry police double standards
item.description: Black Americans say the police response at US Capitol puts "white privilege" on full display.

item.title: Nasa's Curiosity rover: 3,000 days on Mars
item.description: Three thousand days and counting: Nasa's Curiosity rover continues its extraordinary exploration of Mars.

item.title: Turning 21 in 2021: 'This will be a better year'
item.description: Two young women who turn 21 this year reflect on the impact 2020 and the coronavirus pandemic had on their lives and share their hopes for 2021.

item.title: Which country has been hit hardest by coronavirus?
item.description: Key charts and maps explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Uganda elections 2021: Who is Bobi Wine?
item.description: Uganda's Bobi Wine is aiming to unseat President Yoweri Museveni after 35 years in power.

item.title: UK leading the way in use of language-learning apps
item.description: As the pandemic has given us time to fill, more of us are learning a new language.

item.title: Viewpoint: What the Capitol riot means for US foreign policy
item.description: President-elect Joe Biden needs to unite his nation to fix US policy abroad, Jonathan Marcus writes.

item.title: India coronavirus: Can its vaccine makers meet demand?
item.description: India is a big player in global vaccine production - but also one of the worst-hit countries for coronavirus.

item.title: Albania races to rescue children from jihadist camp
item.description: Why Albania wants to repatriate dozens of youngsters from al-Hol in northern Syria.

item.title: Uganda elections 2021: How ex-rebel Yoweri Museveni has stayed in power for 35 years
item.description: Uganda's Yoweri Museveni is running for a sixth elected term in office, against 10 challengers.

item.title: Coronavirus: Virus provides leaps in scientific understanding
item.description: How a year of intense scientific effort unravelled the secrets of a virus that shut down the world.

item.title: Can onboard rollercoasters save the cruise industry?
item.description: The Mardi Gras is going overboard with new features to lure back passengers, including a micro-brewery.

item.title: Trump’s Twitter downfall
item.description: How Trump's favourite social media site banned him - permanently.

item.title: Is elite sport on its final warning after continued football breaches?
item.description: With footballers breaching coronavirus restrictions and attracting the attention of the government, BBC Sport asks whether football is on its final warning.

item.title: When sledging goes wrong - Australia captain Paine's insults backfire
item.description: Australia captain Tim Paine insults Ravichandran Ashwin, drops three catches and sees India pull off a remarkable draw on one of the worst days of his career.

item.title: Tottenham to face Fulham on Wednesday after Spurs' match v Villa postponed
item.description: Spurs will play Fulham on Wednesday in a fixture reshuffle after Tottenham's Premier League match at Aston Villa was postponed because of coronavirus cases in the Villa camp.

item.title: NBA: LA Lakers and LA Clippers win, Boston Celtics v Miami Heat called off
item.description: The Los Angeles Lakers continue their unbeaten run on the road with a comfortable victory over the Houston Rockets.

item.title: European Cups will not be abandoned, say organisers
item.description: This season's European Cups will not be abandoned if the French government decides its clubs cannot play their remaining pool fixtures, the competitions' chief executive says.

item.title: Has Ronaldo equalled the world goalscoring record?
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo is now the joint-top scorer of all time, say many reports, after the 759th goal of his career - but is that true?

item.title: Brees to face Brady in NFL play-offs - wildcard weekend round-up
item.description: Drew Brees will face Tom Brady's Tampa Bay Buccaneers in the divisional round of the NFL play-offs after the New Orleans Saints advance from the super wildcard weekend.

item.title: The airman from Sierra Leone who was shot down over Nazi Germany
item.description: The amazing life of Johnny Smythe - RAF officer, prisoner of war and a father of the Windrush generation.
